title: SUNNY | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
text: sunny adjective us /ˈsʌn.i/ uk /ˈsʌn.i/sunny adjective (BRIGHT) - lightI'll wait until it's light outside before I go for a run. - brightIt was very bright in the exam room. - sunnyThe baby's nursery was bright and sunny. - sunlitThe house boasts a sunlit parlor with floor-to-ceiling windows. - sun-drenchedThey spent a week on the sun-drenched beaches of Bali. sunny adjective (HAPPY) - (as) pleased as Punch idiom - ASMR - be dancing in the streets idiom - be floating on air idiom - be full of the joys of spring idiom - chirpy - chuffed - contented - contentedly - dance - happily - happy camper - happy place idiom - happy to do something - happy with something - self-healing - shining - sunnily - swooning - swooningly Idiom - albacore - American shad - anchovy - barracuda - beluga - elver - flatfish - flathead - flounder - flying fish - pink salmon - plaice - pollack - pomfret - porgy - stickleback - stingray - stonefish - striped bass - sturgeon You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics:
